title: Ticket #205: realpath() on Win32
description:
We'd like an implementation of realpath for Windows that meets the POSIX.1-2008 specification; this is used in the static web server code.

realpath(path, NULL) should resolve all components in path to canonical names (e.g. resolving .. and . elements) and return a newly-allocated C string containing the canonical name for path, or NULL if path does not exist.

On Windows, realpath should also convert every pathname component to the "long file name" version, resolve any substituted drive names, and resolve any reparse points.

See http://bit.ly/4dh6wb for more details on realpath and the POSIX.1-2008 amendments. (CERT mentions that canonicalizing pathnames on Windows is complex, but their alternate solutions are not obviously applicable to our problem.)
remarks:
2009-Feb-10 09:03:08 by willb:
Currently, we use the following macro in my rewrite of the HTTP GET support (not yet upstream): 

#ifdef WIN32
#define realpath(P,B) _fullpath((B),(P),_MAX_PATH)
#endif

This doesn't handle reparse points and doesn't behave the same way as POSIX realpath in the event that the path doesn't exist.
